name: sfchronicle
text: Cal Fire is battling a wildland fire just south of Petaluma in Sonoma County. As of 4 p.m., the blaze burned 20 acres and was 0% percent contained. https://t.co/XRTLhE4fL6

name: sfchronicle
text: The coronavirus outbreak and shelter-in-place mandates have shut down campgrounds and lodging across California. RVs may provide vacationers a workaround. https://t.co/K3rcrADR2Y

name: sfchronicle
text: While many cities in the Bay Area have lifted their curfews stemming from protests over police violence, some, such as in Hayward, remain. Here is the list of curfews, plus major service and business closures. The list will continue to be updated.  https://t.co/bKtPfvFOjc https://t.co/7vtI5cnel2

name: sfchronicle
text:
Walnut Creek has ended its curfew, saying it was “no longer needed to help maintain safety in our city.” The announcement followed the conclusion of a demonstration of about 2,000 people. 

Live updates: https://t.co/u0kw3Oc9zK

name: sfchronicle
text: Demonstrators in San Jose created an altar for black people killed by law enforcement, laid just outside San Jose C… https://t.co/d8IAgexfu5

name: sfchronicle
text: Napa County wineries, bars and tasting rooms can reopen as of today, with social distancing guidelines in place. https://t.co/dsGwLVh7Uz

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @ByLHernandez: Hundreds of people are rallying at San Jose City Hall. Passing cars are honking in support, and protesters are chanting, “Black Lives Matter” to the beat of a traditional Mexica dance group. https://t.co/mZJarsazx4Hundreds of people are rallying at San Jose City Hall. Passing cars are honking in support, and protesters are chan… https://t.co/nzHRpMmLUa

name: sfchronicle
text:
NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell said he and the league “were wrong” for ignoring players’ concerns over the growing evidence of police brutality in this country, adding “black lives matter.”

https://t.co/B2UWOjaqfE

name: sfchronicle
text:
The eighth day of protests in the Bay Area brought new cries for justice. In Oakland, there was a call to eliminate the school district police. In S.F., there was outrage over the killing of a local man by Vallejo police. 

https://t.co/X3ZbYE5t4e

name: sfchronicle
text:
LIVE UPDATES: A group of a few hundred protesters is marching from Vallejo City Hall to the Walgreens where 22-year-old Sean Monterrosa was shot and killed by police Tuesday morning.

https://t.co/YtFMDBF7PV
